popularityCurve.label: we were not far from the house now i saw the drive broaden to the sweep i had expected and with the blood-red wall still flanking on either side we turned the last corner and so came to manderley yes there it was the manderley i had expected the manderley of my picture post-card long ago a thing of grace and beauty exquisite and faultless lovelier even than i had ever dreamed built in its hollow of smooth grassland and mossy lawns the terraces sloping to the gardens and the gardens to the sea as we drove up to the wide stone steps and stopped before the open door i saw through one of the mullioned windows that the hall was full of people
